info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 2:49PM EDT until July 23 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR EASTERN BEAVER...SOUTHERN BUTLER AND NORTHERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES... At 249 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wexford, or near Franklin Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Hampton Township, Economy, Ambridge, Wexford, New Brighton, and Beaver. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
